162209.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy by 3. If Auckes is in your hand, damage that unit by 5 instead.
162209.name: Serrit

162210.flavor: Men require constant alluring. Mystique and refinement do the job quite well.
162210.info:
Spying.
Deploy: Play the top card from your opponent's deck.
162210.infoRaw:
<keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play the top card from your opponent's deck.
162210.name: Cantarella

162211.flavor: To describe the manner in which Duke de Wett led the Verden Group as incompetent would be far too kind.
162211.info:
Spying.
Deploy: Play the top non-Spying unit from your deck, then boost it by 8.
162211.infoRaw:
<keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play the top non-<keyword=spying>Spying</keyword> unit from your deck, then boost it by 8.
162211.name: Joachim de Wett

162212.flavor: Here she comes, he thought, our imperial interest. A mock-princess, a mock-queen for Cintra. A mock-ruler for the mouth of the Yarra, future lifeblood of the empire.
162212.info:
Deploy, Melee: Move an enemy to the other row.
Deploy, Ranged: Destroy an enemy artifact.
162212.infoRaw:
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Move an enemy to the other row.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: Destroy an enemy artifact.
162212.name: False Ciri

162213.flavor: Your Imperial Highness… blurted out the seneschal, whose presence until now had been thoroughly ignored. I beg your pardon, but Cahir… My son...
162213.info: Deploy:  Remove all statuses from all units on the battlefield.
162213.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>:  Remove all statuses from all units on the battlefield.
162213.name: Ceallach Dyffryn

162301.flavor: Learned a lot at Braibant Military Academy. How to scrub potatoes, for instance.
162301.info: When you Reveal this unit, Summon it from your deck to a random allied row.
162301.infoRaw: When you <keyword=reveal>Reveal</keyword> this unit, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it from your deck to a random allied row.
162301.name: Daerlan Soldier

162302.flavor: Let historians debate whether spreading plague in a besieged city is ethical. We just care if it's effective.
162302.info: Deploy, Ranged: Spawn and play a Cow Carcass.
162302.name: Rot Tosser

162303.flavor: The North has nothing with which it could surprise us.
162303.info: Deploy, Melee: Reveal a random unit from your opponent's deck and boost self by its power.
162303.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: <keyword=reveal>Reveal</keyword> a random unit from your opponent's deck and boost self by its power.
162303.name: Spotter

162304.flavor: Well... At least, I can't make you more dead...
162304.info: Play a bronze unit from your opponent's graveyard.
162304.infoRaw: Play a bronze unit from your opponent's graveyard.
162304.name: Experimental Remedy

162305.flavor: I aim for the knees. Always.
162305.info: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 2, then Reveal a random unit from both decks. If yours has more power, repeat the Deploy ability.
162305.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy by 2, then <keyword=reveal>Reveal</keyword> a random unit from both decks. If yours has more power, repeat the <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> ability.
162305.name: Deithwen Arbalest

162306.flavor: Name's terribly misleading, makes it sound like some corpulent reddish arachnid, not an exquisitely engineered weapon of mass destruction...
162306.info:
Order, Ranged: Damage a unit by 1. 
Charge: 1.
Gain 1 Charge whenever you play a Tactic card.
162306.infoRaw:
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>, <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: Damage a unit by 1. 
<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1.
Gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword> whenever you play a Tactic card.
162306.name: Fire Scorpion

162307.flavor: The Impera Brigade never surrenders. Ever.
162307.info: Deploy, Melee: Summon a copy of this unit from your deck to this row.
162307.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a copy of this unit from your deck to this row.
162307.name: Impera Brigade

162308.flavor: Members of the emperor's fanatic body guard fight to the bitter end.
162308.info:
Order: Damage an enemy by 2.
Charge: 1.
Gain 1 Charge whenever you play a Spying unit.
162308.infoRaw:
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy by 2.
<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1.
Gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword> whenever you play a <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword> unit.
162308.name: Impera Enforcers

162309.flavor: The Emperor will teach the North discipline.
162309.info: Whenever you play a unit with Deploy, boost self by 1.
162309.infoRaw: Whenever you play a unit with <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, boost self by 1.
162309.name: Nauzicaa Sergeant

162310.flavor: They call us Death's Heads. Care to find out why?
162310.info: Deploy: Damage a boosted enemy by 3.
162310.name: Nauzicaa Brigade

162311.flavor: Pledge your allegiance to our Emperor, Emhyr var Emreis… or die.
162311.info: Deploy, Melee: Damage an enemy by the number of units on its other row.
162311.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Damage an enemy by the number of units on its other row.
162311.name: Alba Pikeman

162312.info: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 2. Increase the damage by 1 for each adjacent Soldier.
162312.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy by 2. Increase the damage by 1 for each adjacent Soldier.
162312.name: Alba Spearman

162313.flavor: Want irrefutable proof of civilization's advance? Look at war. Man gets better at killing with each one.
162313.info: Deploy: If you control an artifact, boost self by 3.
162313.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If you control an artifact, boost self by 3.
162313.name: Combat Engineer

162314.flavor: But… but there's no justice in it! One does not kill the messenger!
162314.info:
Spying.
Deploy: Boost an ally by 7.
162314.name: Emissary

162315.flavor: A spy? No, that's saying far too much. I consider myself more of an observer.
162315.info: Create and play a bronze unit from your opponent's faction.
162315.infoRaw: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze unit from your opponent's faction.
162315.name: Imperial Diplomacy

162316.flavor: Two ounces of calcium equum, one ounce of rubedo…
162316.info: Deploy, Ranged: Swap the power of 2 allies.
162316.name: Alchemist

162317.flavor: This model specializes in slinging corpses and ripe dung.
162317.info: Whenever you Reveal a card, damage a random enemy by 1.
162317.infoRaw: Whenever you <keyword=reveal>Reveal</keyword> a card, damage a random enemy by 1.
162317.name: Mangonel

162318.flavor: Sons of noble houses, born in the City of the Golden Towers, form the elite backbone of the Imperial Army.
162318.info: Deploy: Boost an enemy by 2. If there are no enemy units, destroy self.
162318.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an enemy by 2. If there are no enemy units, destroy self.
162318.name: Nilfgaardian Knight

162401.flavor: Stone fists to stop intruders armed with swords. Ironclad logic to stop those armed with lies.
162401.name: The Guardian

162402.flavor: That a bird? That a griffin? Naye! That's a…
162402.info:
Spying. Doomed.
After 1 turn, on turn end, destroy this unit and the unit on its left.
162402.infoRaw:
<keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>. <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
After 1 turn, on turn end, destroy this unit and the unit on its left.
162402.name: Cow Carcass

163101.flavor: In Nilfgaard, trustful people are considered an endangered species.
163101.info: Force an enemy unit to damage adjacent units by its own power.
163101.infoRaw: Force an enemy unit to damage adjacent units by its own power.
163101.name: Treason

163201.flavor: Many believe the empire's power rests upon the shoulders of its disciplined army and dutiful mages. In truth, the Nilfgaardian floren rules the world.
163201.info: Create a unit from your opponent's starting deck, then play it.
163201.infoRaw: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> a unit from your opponent's starting deck, then play it.
163201.name: Bribery

200008.flavor: A mage responsible for dozens of brilliant inventions. The mind of a generation. Commonly referred to around the Continent as that bloke with the dish.
200008.info:
Zeal.
Order: Boost an ally by 3 and give it Zeal.
200008.infoRaw:
<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an ally by 3 and give it <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
200008.name: Petri's Philter

200018.flavor: Vicovaro scholars have determined that, in the absence of imperial aid, drought-stricken provinces lose half their population, two-thirds of their livestock and all their will to rebel.
200018.info: Banish a unit or an artifact.
200018.name: Korathi Heatwave

200019.flavor: We are but pawns in a game played by old men, sent to fight and die on their senile whims…
200019.info: Play the lowest unit from your deck.
200019.infoRaw: Play the lowest unit from your deck.
200019.name: Marching Orders

200020.flavor: We have ways of making you talk… alive or dead.
200020.info: Play a bronze unit from your graveyard and give it Doomed.
200020.infoRaw: Play a bronze unit from your graveyard and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
200020.name: Necromancy

200022.flavor: There exist a great many realities outside our own… With the right knowledge, one can contact them and summon beings beyond human fathoming.
200022.info:
Zeal.
Order: Play a unit from your deck whose Recruit Cost is less than or equal to Summoning Circle's Charge count, then remove all Charges.
Charge: 0.
Every turn, on turn start, gain 1 Charge.
200022.infoRaw:
<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Play a unit from your deck whose Recruit Cost is less than or equal to Summoning Circle's <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword> count, then remove all <keyword=charge>Charges</keyword>.
<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 0.
Every turn, on turn start, gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>.
200022.name: Summoning Circle

200023.flavor: If substance makes contact with eyes, rinse immediately with cold water, then commence drawing up will.
200023.info: Damage a unit by 3. If it was destroyed, damage its adjacent units by 3.
200023.infoRaw: Damage a unit by 3. If it was destroyed, damage its adjacent units by 3.
200023.name: Arachas Venom

200026.flavor: For hundreds of years, Avallac'h tried to recreate the Elder Blood gene through back breeding - yet the elven children thus fostered were but dim sparks compared to Lara's flame.
200026.info: Deploy: Boost an allied unit by 1. If you control the highest unit, boost by 3 instead.
200026.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 1. If you control the highest unit, boost by 3 instead.
200026.name: Wild Hunt Navigator

200028.flavor: Blood for Svalblod! Skulls for his throne!
200028.info: Deploy, Melee: Destroy a damaged enemy.
200028.name: Vabjorn

200030.flavor: The old baron treated poachers mercilessly. Luckily for Milaen, the old baron was dead and his men, desperate outlaws.
200030.info:
Deploy, Melee: Damage an enemy by 4.
Deploy, Ranged: Damage 4 enemies by 1.
200030.infoRaw:
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Damage an enemy by 4.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: Damage 4 enemies by 1.
200030.name: Milaen

200031.flavor: He would just sit there and stare at me, not saying a word. His eyes, they were… fish-like, somehow. No brows, no lashes… Just these balls of water, with a black stone sunk in each. He would devour me with those eyes in total silence. That frightened me more than the beatings.
200031.info:
Deploy, Melee: Destroy an enemy with 8 or more power.
Deploy, Ranged: Destroy a Witcher.
200031.infoRaw:
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Destroy an enemy with 8 or more power.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: Destroy a Witcher.
200031.name: Leo Bonhart

200032.flavor: When Cintra fell, Attre followed, leaving its defenders a choice: accept the Nilfgaardian leash or die.
200032.info: Deploy: Boost an enemy by 3, then boost self by 3.
200032.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an enemy by 3, then boost self by 3.
200032.name: Rainfarn of Attre

200033.flavor: The adepts' every whim is catered to - they live like princesses at Aretuza. And in turn half the city lives off servicing them: seamstresses, milliners, confectioners, delivery boys…
200033.info:
Zeal.
Order, Ranged: Give 1 Charge to an allied unit.
Cooldown: 2.
200033.name: Aretuza Adept

200036.flavor: Think o' the greater good?! War's the greatest good, the greatest bad, the greatest damn anythin' man's ever come up with!
200036.info: Deploy, Melee, Bloodthirst 1: Destroy an enemy artifact.
200036.name: Drummond Warmonger

200037.flavor: Don't stare at his eye, he hates that…
200037.info: Deploy: Destroy an adjacent allied unit and damage an enemy by its power.
200037.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Destroy an adjacent allied unit and damage an enemy by its power.
200037.name: Cyclops

200038.flavor: Folklore claims they sprout from soil watered with the blood of the dying. Thus they flourish in grounds consecrated by pogroms, dark rituals or brutal murders.
200038.info:
Thrive.
Deploy: Damage a random enemy by 2. 
Deathwish: Repeat the Deploy ability.
200038.infoRaw:
<keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage a random enemy by 2. 
<keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: Repeat the <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> ability.
200038.name: Archespore

200039.flavor: As long as we stand, no human foot shall trample Dol Blathanna's meadows.
200039.info:
Melee: Whenever an enemy is moved to the other row, damage it by 1.
Ranged: Whenever an ally is moved to the other row, boost it by 1.
200039.infoRaw:
<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Whenever an enemy is moved to the other row, damage it by 1.
<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: Whenever an ally is moved to the other row, boost it by 1.
200039.name: Dol Blathanna Sentry

200040.flavor: Ahh, ye gave me a good laugh there, Nordling! Why, this bastard, ye couldn't even grip it, let alone gut me with it.
200040.info: Whenever an enemy on the opposite row takes damage, boost self by 1.
200040.infoRaw: Whenever an enemy on the opposite row takes damage, boost self by 1.
200040.name: An Craite Greatsword

200041.flavor: Not the best for taking cities, but great for razing them to the ground.
200041.info:
Immune.
Order: Damage an enemy by 2 for each Soldier on this row.
200041.infoRaw:
<keyword=immune>Immune</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy by 2 for each Soldier on this row.
200041.name: Hefty Helge

200042.flavor: Hunting on Mahakam's craggy cliffs is not particularly easy… but nor are dwarves particularly put off by danger.
200042.info: Deploy: If this unit is already boosted, gain Resilience.
200042.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If this unit is already boosted, gain <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.
200042.name: Mahakam Marauder

200043.flavor: Once proud jarl of Clan Tordarroch, now a muttering madman.
200043.info:
Deploy: Spawn 3 of Harald's Pals and Summon them to your other allied row.
Order: Damage an ally by 1.
Cooldown: 1.
200043.infoRaw:
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 3 of Harald's Pals and <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> them to your other allied row.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an ally by 1.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1.
200043.name: Harald Houndsnout

200044.flavor: I know the Emperor defends all his lands... but a garrison in this blasted waste is like a chastity belt on a grave hag.
200044.info: Every turn, on turn end, boost self by 1 if this is the only card on this row.
200044.infoRaw: Every turn, on turn end, boost self by 1 if this is the only card on this row.
200044.name: Magne Division

200046.flavor: In my days I've seen wonders no man's ever dreamt of, and done things no man should ever do.
200046.name: Tuirseach Veteran

200048.flavor: I'm constantly comparing the achievements of Aretuza's adepts with the work done by the lads at Ban Ard, and my conclusion constantly falls in favor of the girls.
200048.info: Deploy: Boost an ally by 1 for each of its Charges.
200048.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an ally by 1 for each of its <keyword=charge>Charges</keyword>.
200048.name: Ban Ard Tutor

200049.flavor: Not gonna open up, eh? Guess we gotta knock harder.
200049.info: Deploy: If you control a Soldier, destroy an enemy artifact.
200049.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If you control a Soldier, destroy an enemy artifact.
200049.name: Battering Ram

200050.flavor: The Great Sun shall warm the North with its rays, even if it means I must slaughter you all!
200050.info: Deploy: Boost a Soldier ally and all copies of it by 2.
200050.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost a Soldier ally and all copies of it by 2.
200050.name: Vreemde

200052.flavor: Some claim Golyat was once a famous knight. Sadly, one day he earned the wrath of the Lady of the Lake, who turned him into a monster.
200052.info: Deathwish: Your opponent Summons the lowest unit from their deck on the opposite row.
200052.infoRaw: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: Your opponent <keyword=summon>Summons</keyword> the lowest unit from their deck on the opposite row.
200052.name: Golyat

200053.flavor: The figurine expanded in a flash, pulsing and throbbing, changing its shape and structure like a puff of smoke crawling over the floor. Beams of light revealed movement and hardening materials. A moment later, in the center of the magic circle a human form suddenly appeared.
200053.info: Lock a unit and restore it to its base power.
200053.infoRaw: <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> a unit and restore it to its base power.
200053.name: Artefact Compression

200055.flavor: No one, not even among the higher vampires, knows exactly how old the Unseen Elder is. They only know they should never, under any circumstances, defy his will.
200055.info:
Order: Trigger an ally's Deathwish ability.
On round start, refresh this ability.
200055.infoRaw:
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Trigger an ally's <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword> ability.
On round start, refresh this ability.
200055.name: Unseen Elder

200056.flavor: Ever heard of an anterion? Think of it as the opposite of a lycanthrope: a beast which can take on human form.
200056.info: Deploy, Ranged: Create any special card.
200056.name: Aguara: True Form

200058.flavor: I give you three solid leads, trails as fresh as morning dew, the aid of my spies and my court sorceress. Yet in my daughter's stead, you bring me this… monstrosity?
200058.info: Create and play a gold unit.
200058.name: Uma's Curse

200062.flavor: Smarten up right now, or it's off to an aguara with you!
200062.info:
Deploy, Melee: Lock a unit.
Deploy, Ranged: Remove a unit's Lock.
200062.name: Aguara

200071.flavor: A diplomat is a man who uses many more words than necessary to express much less than he knows.
200071.info: Deploy: Set the power of the highest unit in your opponent's hand to 1.
200071.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Set the power of the highest unit in your opponent's hand to 1.
200071.name: Shilard Fitz-Oesterlen

200073.flavor: And the striga's doin' fine. Sure, she takes a bite outta someone from time to time, but you get used to that.
200073.info: Deploy: If you control the highest unit, damage an enemy by 5.
200073.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If you control the highest unit, damage an enemy by 5.
200073.name: Adda: Striga

200078.flavor: Imagine a lump of clay. In order to shape it, you must first moisten it or it will crumble. The Trial's initial part does just that. It opens the body to change, so to speak. Only then can the mutagens produce a witcher.
200078.info: Boost a unit to 12 power. If it's not a Witcher, damage it by 6 first.
200078.infoRaw: Boost a unit to 12 power. If it's not a Witcher, damage it by 6 first.
200078.name: Trial of the Grasses

200079.flavor: This spell lets you see the last moments of a dead man's life… if you can survive its casting.
200079.info: Play a unit from the opponent's graveyard and give it Doomed.
200079.infoRaw: Play a unit from the opponent's graveyard and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
200079.name: Hanmarvyn's Blue Dream

200080.flavor: Well? Somethin' wrong? Venison a wee bit rank for ye? Ehh, princess?
200080.info: Melee: Whenever this unit receives a boost, boost it by an additional 2.
200080.infoRaw: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Whenever this unit receives a boost, boost it by an additional 2.
200080.name: Xavier Moran

200081.flavor: We don't burn cunning women in Skellige - we take their advice.
200081.info: Deploy, Ranged: Heal an ally by 2, then boost it by 2.
200081.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> an ally by 2, then boost it by 2.
200081.name: Heymaey Herbalist

200083.flavor: We'd rather keep our names to ourselves. Think of us as… friends of the house.
200083.info: Deploy: Draw a card of your choice from your deck, then Discard a random card.
200083.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Draw a card of your choice from your deck, then <keyword=discard>Discard</keyword> a random card.
200083.name: Iris' Companions

200087.flavor: Like the witchers, Dorregaray is a monster aficionado, though he's developed his own classification system. Instead of dividing them into necrophages, ogroids and the like, he just thinks they're all wonderful.
200087.name: Dorregaray of Vole

200088.flavor: The coroner is a calm, peaceful person. He even treats corpses with the utmost delicacy.
200088.info: Deploy: Boost self by the amount of damage you dealt to enemies on this turn.
200088.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by the amount of damage you dealt to enemies on this turn.
200088.name: Hubert Rejk

200089.flavor: Lost? Well, go be lost somewhere else. Somewhere not on my property, that is. Point your left ear to the sun and keep walking, you'll hit the road soon enough. Well? What're you waiting for?
200089.info: Deploy: Move all units from one row to the other row.
200089.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move all units from one row to the other row.
200089.name: Nivellen

200091.flavor: The witcher had met thieves that looked like town councilors, town councilors that looked like beggars and kings that looked like thieves. Stregobor, though, always looked exactly like the commonly accepted imagining of a what a mage should look like.
200091.info: Ranged: After 2 turns, each player draws a unit and sets its power to 1.
200091.infoRaw: <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: After 2 turns, each player draws a unit and sets its power to 1.
200091.name: Stregobor

200098.flavor: By day, Captain of the Vizima City Guard. By night, merciless avenger and defender of the downtrodden.
200098.info:
Zeal.
Order, Melee: Set the power of a non-boosted enemy to 1.
200098.infoRaw:
<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Set the power of a non-boosted enemy to 1.
200098.name: Vincent Meis

200102.flavor: The gods' speak to me… I hear them whisper from the shadows…
200102.info: Deploy: Swap this unit's power with a damaged unit's power.
200102.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Swap this unit's power with a damaged unit's power.
200102.name: Hym

200103.flavor: 10-time winner of the venerable title of Champion of the An Skellig Arena.
200103.info: Order: Boost Olaf by twice the amount he is damaged.
200103.infoRaw: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost Olaf by twice the amount he is damaged.
200103.name: Olaf

200104.flavor: Werewolf? Oh, no, no… this is something far, far worse.
200104.info: Deploy: Damage an enemy by half of its current power.
200104.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy by half of its current power.
200104.name: Ulfhedinn

200105.flavor: Clan Dimun warships are light and fast, perfect for racing down slow merchant frigates.
200105.info: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 1 three times.
200105.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy by 1 three times.
200105.name: Dimun Warship

200112.flavor: Legends claim they lure sailors to their doom with their entrancing songs… though more likely, the sailors were more entranced by their other ample charms.
200112.info: Deploy: Boost a Deathwish ally by 3.
200112.name: Siren

200114.flavor: Some say lycanthropy's contagious - get bit by a werewolf, you turn into one yourself. Witchers know that's nonsense, of course - only a powerful curse can bring on this condition.
200114.name: Alpha Werewolf

200115.flavor: Assassin — one of the most popular professions at the imperial court, just after scribe and courtesan.
200115.info: Damage a unit by 6. Decrease the damage by 1 for each unit adjacent to it.
200115.infoRaw: Damage a unit by 6. Decrease the damage by 1 for each unit adjacent to it.
200115.name: Assassination

200118.flavor: You can run, but you'll never hide.
200118.info: Melee: On round end, shuffle this unit into your opponent's deck.
200118.infoRaw: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: On round end, shuffle this unit into your opponent's deck.
200118.name: Infiltrator

200124.flavor: The School of the Viper shall be reborn… Letho saw to that.
200124.info: Deploy: Reveal the top card from your opponent's deck and Banish it.
200124.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=reveal>Reveal</keyword> the top card from your opponent's deck and <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> it.
200124.name: Viper Witcher

200135.flavor: An extraordinarily risky, and thus much revered, Mahakam trade. Its best-known practitioner was a dwarf by the name of Mikkel Bay.
200135.info:
Zeal.
Order: Destroy an allied artifact and damage a unit by 2. 
Cooldown: 2.
200135.infoRaw:
<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Destroy an allied artifact and damage a unit by 2. 
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2.
200135.name: Pyrotechnician

200136.flavor: Her words might seem unintelligible at times, but they always contain hidden meanings and tremendous wisdom.
200136.info: Deploy, Ranged: Reveal a random card from your deck. If it's a special card, boost self by 2.
200136.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: <keyword=reveal>Reveal</keyword> a random card from your deck. If it's a special card, boost self by 2.
200136.name: Farseer

200138.flavor: Knowledge, my dear, is a privilege, and privileges are only shared among equals.
200138.info: Whenever you play a special card, boost self by 2.
200138.infoRaw: Whenever you play a special card, boost self by 2.
200138.name: Sage

200139.flavor: An Oxenfurt scholar once examined a panther and declared it was nothing more than a leopard of a different color. The panther seemed indifferent to this pronouncement and gobbled him up before he could complete his research.
200139.info: Deploy: Damage a non-Scoia'tael enemy unit by 3.
200139.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage a non-Scoia'tael enemy unit by 3.
200139.name: Panther

200144.flavor: Don't touch him. Don't look him in the eyes. In fact… don't go anywhere near him.
200144.info: Deploy: Boost a Beast ally by 2. Increase the boost by 1 for every Beast in your graveyard.
200144.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost a Beast ally by 2. Increase the boost by 1 for every Beast in your graveyard.
200144.name: Tuirseach Bearmaster

200145.flavor: The sea's ours, along with everythin' that floats, swims or sails in it!
200145.info: Deploy: Damage a unit by 1 for every Ship in your hand.
200145.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage a unit by 1 for every Ship in your hand.
200145.name: Dimun Corsair

200146.flavor: Spikeroog's a barren backwater, but that don't bother us - everythin' we need, we take from you.
200146.info: Deploy, Melee: Damage a unit by 1, then boost the same unit by 2.
200146.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Damage a unit by 1, then boost the same unit by 2.
200146.name: Dimun Smuggler

200147.flavor: A flaminica, the highest position among the druidesses, commands a great deal of respect and wields a great deal of power.
200147.info: Every turn, on turn end, Heal all damaged allies on this row by 1.
200147.infoRaw: Every turn, on turn end, <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> all damaged allies on this row by 1.
200147.name: Heymaey Flaminica

200149.flavor: He fears nothing save Freya's wrath... and his wife's.
200149.info: Whenever an adjacent unit takes damage, boost self by 1.
200149.infoRaw: Whenever an adjacent unit takes damage, boost self by 1.
200149.name: Heymaey Protector

200154.flavor: We, Foltest, by divine right King of Temeria, Prince of Sodden, Senior Protector of Brugge, etcetera, etcetera, do hereby decree the following…
200154.info: Play a unit from your deck.
200154.infoRaw: Play a unit from your deck.
200154.name: Royal Decree

200159.flavor: No one can replace Bran. Though they're sure to try.
200159.info:
Order: Discard a card, then draw a card.
On round start, refresh this ability.
Whenever you Discard a card, damage a random enemy by 1.
200159.infoRaw:
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=discard>Discard</keyword> a card, then draw a card.
On round start, refresh this ability.
Whenever you <keyword=discard>Discard</keyword> a card, damage a random enemy by 1.
200159.name: Bran Tuirseach

200160.flavor: Nilfgaardians call 'im Tirth ys Muire, the Wild Boar o' the Sea. Use 'im to scare their kiddies!
200160.info:
Order: Damage a unit by 1. 
Cooldown: 2.
200160.name: Crach an Craite

200161.flavor: No one knows how he got his nickname – no one's dared to ask.
200161.info: Order: Split 8 damage randomly between all enemies.
200161.infoRaw: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Split 8 damage randomly between all enemies.
200161.name: Harald the Cripple

200162.flavor: They do not call me the Patient. Take care they do not call you the Headless.
200162.info: Order: Move an allied unit or artifact back to your hand, then play a card.
200162.infoRaw: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Move an allied unit or artifact back to your hand, then play a card.
200162.name: Emhyr var Emreis

200163.flavor: The summer sun reflected in the quiet waters of the Alba – that's Nilfgaard to me.
200163.info:
Order: Reveal a random card from your opponent's deck. If it's bronze, boost an ally by 3. If gold, boost by 4 instead.
On round start, refresh this ability.
200163.infoRaw:
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=reveal>Reveal</keyword> a random card from your opponent's deck. If it's bronze, boost an ally by 3. If gold, boost by 4 instead.
On round start, refresh this ability.
200163.name: Morvran Voorhis

200164.flavor: A sword is but one of many tools at a ruler's disposal.
200164.info: Order: Look at the top 3 cards from your deck and play one.
200164.infoRaw: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Look at the top 3 cards from your deck and play one.
200164.name: Jan Calveit

200165.flavor: To live in peace, we first must kill. This is human oppression's cruel finale.
200165.info: Order: Play a special card from your graveyard.
200165.infoRaw: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Play a special card from your graveyard.
200165.name: Francesca Findabair

200166.flavor: The dryad queen has eyes of molten silver, and a heart of cold–forged steel.
200166.info:
Order: Damage a unit by 1.
Charge: 3.
On round start, refresh Eithné's Charge count.
200166.infoRaw:
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by 1.
<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 3.
On round start, refresh Eithné's <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword> count.
200166.name: Eithné

200167.flavor: That doddery dolt? Ye cannae even tell if he's alive or stuffed!
200167.info:
Order: Move a unit to the other row. If it's an enemy, damage it by 2; if it's an ally, boost it by 2. 
Charge: 3.
200167.infoRaw:
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Move a unit to the other row. If it's an enemy, damage it by 2; if it's an ally, boost it by 2. 
<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 3.
200167.name: Brouver Hoog

200168.flavor: Don't need advisors and their schemes. I place my trust in my soldiers' blades.
200168.info:
Order: Boost an ally by 1 and give it Zeal.
Charge: 3.
200168.infoRaw:
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an ally by 1 and give it <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 3.
200168.name: King Foltest

200170.flavor: King Henselt did not look like a thief, but, with all due respect, that's really what he was.
200170.info: Order: Play a copy of an allied unit on the battlefield from your deck, boost it by 4, and give it Zeal.
200170.infoRaw: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Play a copy of an allied unit on the battlefield from your deck, boost it by 4, and give it <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
200170.name: King Henselt

200171.flavor: Soldiers loyal to the old baron of Tridam left the city with Falibor, thus becoming renegades wanted by the law.
200171.info: Whenever this unit receives a boost, damage a random enemy by 1.
200171.infoRaw: Whenever this unit receives a boost, damage a random enemy by 1.
200171.name: Tridam Infantry

200177.flavor: They call me Sparrowhawk. Know why? Because I eat rats like you for breakfast.
200177.info: If this unit is in the graveyard, Summon it to a random allied row whenever you play a unit from your graveyard.
200177.infoRaw: If this unit is in the graveyard, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it to a random allied row whenever you play a unit from your graveyard.
200177.name: Cerys an Craite

200209.flavor: I care not for kings and their titles. In the east lives one who truly deserves a crown.
200209.info:
Order: Damage an enemy by 2.
Cooldown: 4.
If you have an Elf, Dwarf, or Dryad in your hand, decrease Cooldown by 1 (limited once per category).
200209.infoRaw:
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy by 2.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 4.
If you have an Elf, Dwarf, or Dryad in your hand, decrease <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> by 1 (limited once per category).
200209.name: Saskia

200212.flavor: Strike his name from the Saga of Elders! No one dare grant him shelter or sustenance!
200212.info: Deploy: Damage an undamaged enemy by 4.
200212.name: Skjall

200218.flavor: Skellige legend claims the mighty and terrible Jotunn, King of Giants, reigned over the isles in ancient times. He was slain by Hemdall, but with his dying breath he vowed to return for Ragh nar Roog.
200218.info: Deploy, Melee: Boost self by 2 for every unit more your opponent has on the battlefield.
200218.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Boost self by 2 for every unit more your opponent has on the battlefield.
200218.name: Jotunn

200220.flavor: I'd be your best – and last.
200220.info: Deploy, Ranged: Play an Organic card from your deck.
200220.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: Play an Organic card from your deck.
200220.name: Whispess: Tribute

200221.flavor: We'll cut you up, boy. A fine broth you'll make.
200221.name: Ritual Sacrifice

200222.flavor: I sense your pain. I see your fear.
200222.info: Deploy, Melee: Consume a unit in your hand and draw a card.
200222.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> a unit in your hand and draw a card.
200222.name: Weavess: Incantation

200223.flavor: There you all stand! With wonderment awake, doubting the plan and high-discovery. Some, as if grappled by the fell mandrake, some, by the black dog's devilry.
200223.name: Mandrake

200224.flavor: A certain famous pirate once so loved this intoxicating herb, he earned the nickname 'Crow's Eye.' The theatrical version of his legend omits this, however, to the great consternation of pirate lore sticklers.
200224.info: Trigger a bronze unit's Deathwish ability.
200224.name: Crow's Eye

200225.flavor: Never has there been a beast Fringilla Vigo could not tame.
200225.info: Seize an enemy with 5 or less power and Lock it.
200225.infoRaw: <keyword=seize>Seize</keyword> an enemy with 5 or less power and <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> it.
200225.name: Vigo's Muzzle

200226.flavor: Also known as 'the queen of poisons,' wolfsbane is used in many witcher Potions and alchemic brews.
200226.info: Damage all enemies with even power by 2, or damage all enemies with odd power by 2.
200226.infoRaw: Damage all enemies with even power by 2, or damage all enemies with odd power by 2.
200226.name: Wolfsbane

200228.flavor: Simple, cheap and deadly efficient - no wonder it's one of the Scoia'tael's favorite traps.
200228.info: Ambush: Destroy the next unit played by your opponent before it triggers any abilities.
200228.infoRaw: <keyword=ambush>Ambush</keyword>: Destroy the next unit played by your opponent before it triggers any abilities.
200228.name: Pitfall Trap

200233.flavor: Always strikes between the vertebrae, under your left kidney or straight into your aorta. That way, it only needs to strike once.
200233.info: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 2 for each adjacent Beast.
200233.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy by 2 for each adjacent Beast.
200233.name: Cockatrice

200234.flavor: I's a war veteran! Spare me a crown?
200234.name: Poor Fucking Infantry

200235.flavor: Go teach your grandma to suck eggs.
200235.info: Deploy: Destroy an enemy with Resilience.
200235.name: Lambert: Swordmaster

200236.flavor: Heard you panting from three miles away. Just didn't wanna give up that vantage point.
200236.info: Melee: Every turn, on turn end, boost self by 1.
200236.infoRaw: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Every turn, on turn end, boost self by 1.
200236.name: Eskel: Pathfinder

200237.flavor: Killing monsters is not something to be taken lightly. Ciri must understand that if she's to become one of us.
200237.info: Deploy: Boost all Witcher allies in hand, deck, and on the battlefield by 1.
200237.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost all Witcher allies in hand, deck, and on the battlefield by 1.
200237.name: Vesemir: Mentor

200293.flavor: Mark me words, if ye dinnae get up off yer arses, humans're gonnae come here an' steal our wenches!
200293.info: Deploy, Ranged: Boost a Dwarf in your hand by 2.
200293.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: Boost a Dwarf in your hand by 2.
200293.name: Dwarven Agitator

200294.flavor: You shall defend this standard if it costs you your lives! Gloir aen Ard Feain!
200294.info:
Deploy: Boost an ally by 2.
Whenever you Reveal this card, boost a random ally by 2.
200294.infoRaw:
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an ally by 2.
Whenever you <keyword=reveal>Reveal</keyword> this card, boost a random ally by 2.
200294.name: Standard Bearer

200295.flavor: You'll smell them long before you see them.
200295.info: Deathwish: Damage a random enemy by 4.
200295.name: Rotfiend

200296.flavor: The wedge of riders thundered into the phalanx with crushing momentum. Like a dagger thrust into an exposed belly, the Alba Division swept unhindered through everything between it and the vital organs of the Temerian Infantry.
200296.info: Deploy, Melee: Lock an enemy unit.
200296.name: Alba Armored Cavalry

200299.flavor: Not the career he had in mind when he told mummy he wanted to be a musician.
200299.info: Order: Boost an ally by 1 and give it Zeal.
200299.infoRaw: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an ally by 1 and give it <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
200299.name: Temerian Drummer

200300.flavor: Skelligers have long known that harpoons are effective against more than mere whales...
200300.info: Move an enemy to the other row and damage it by the number of units on that row.
200300.infoRaw: Move an enemy to the other row and damage it by the number of units on that row.
200300.name: Trophy Catch

200301.flavor: Waves pummel the shore, waves pushed by the prow of the spectral Naglfar. Hemdall's horn rings in the air, and Hemdall stands facing his enemies atop Bifrost, the burning rainbow. The White Frost is nigh, nigh is the time of gale and storm…
200301.info: Look at 2 random gold cards from your deck, then play one and place the other on top.
200301.infoRaw: Look at 2 random gold cards from your deck, then play one and place the other on top.
200301.name: Naglfar

200320.flavor: A member of the Bovine Defense Force. Semper fi!
200320.name: Chort

200502.flavor: Trolls come in many varieties, with differing shapes, sizes and predilections, though always with about as much brains as a bucket of rusty nails.
200502.info: Every turn, on turn end, if you control fewer units on the battlefield than your opponent, boost self by 1.
200502.infoRaw: Every turn, on turn end, if you control fewer units on the battlefield than your opponent, boost self by 1.
200502.name: Ice Troll

200518.flavor: Ebbing is famed for its top-notch mercenaries and light cavalry.
200518.info: Deploy: If your Leader's ability was used this turn, damage an enemy by 3.
200518.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If your Leader's ability was used this turn, damage an enemy by 3.
200518.name: Venendal Elite

200519.flavor: Considered to be the dwarves' greatest contribution to world culture.
200519.info: Boost a unit by 4 and remove its Lock.
200519.infoRaw: Boost a unit by 4 and remove its <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword>.
200519.name: Mahakam Ale

200520.flavor: Only thing that can rival his swords? His dumplings.
200520.info: Order: Play a bronze artifact from your graveyard.
200520.infoRaw: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Play a bronze artifact from your graveyard.
200520.name: Éibhear Hattori

200523.flavor: The hero Toussaint needs, but not the one it deserves.
200523.info: Deploy, Melee: Spawn 2 Cows on both sides of this unit.
200523.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Cows on both sides of this unit.
200523.name: Germain Piquant

200528.flavor: Skellige women are wild and unpredictable. All units are to treat them as serious threats and never underestimate their capabilities. - General Directive to the Invading Forces of the Imperial Armada
200528.info: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 3, then damage self by 2.
200528.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy by 3, then damage self by 2.
200528.name: Heymaey Spearmaiden

200529.flavor: This self-dubbed knight roams the world defending the honor of his beloved Maid Bilberry - though none are certain where she lives, if she lives still or if she ever lived at all.
200529.info:
Deploy: Boost self by 5.
Whenever you play a Soldier, Summon this unit from your graveyard to a random allied row.
200529.infoRaw:
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 5.
Whenever you play a Soldier, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> this unit from your graveyard to a random allied row.
200529.name: Ronvid the Incessant

200530.flavor: That beer supposed to be green…?
200530.info:
Zeal.
Order: Damage a unit by 2. 
Charge: 3.
200530.name: Tainted Ale

200532.flavor: Boros, the legendary founder of Clan Fuchs, died after overindulging in this beverage - he passed out while reaching for his golden ring, which had fallen into a brook.
200532.info:
Zeal.
Order: Boost a unit by 3. 
Cooldown: 2.
200532.name: Ale of the Ancestors

200534.flavor: Lover of elf and onion soup.
200534.info: Melee: Whenever an ally is destroyed during your turn, boost self by 2.
200534.infoRaw: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Whenever an ally is destroyed during your turn, boost self by 2.
200534.name: She-Troll of Vergen

200535.flavor: Combat is a dance, and you must never allow your opponent to lead.
200535.info:
Order, Melee: Damage an enemy by 1.
Cooldown: 2.
Whenever you play an Elf, decrease Cooldown by 1.
200535.infoRaw:
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Damage an enemy by 1.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2.
Whenever you play an Elf, decrease <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> by 1.
200535.name: Elven Swordmaster

200539.flavor: No man alive, no matter his brawn, no matter his skill, can parry a blow dealt by the tail of a slyzard, the pincers of a giant scorpion or the claws of a griffin.
200539.info:
Order: Consume an allied unit on this row.
Cooldown: 1.
200539.infoRaw:
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit on this row.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1.
200539.name: Slyzard

200540.flavor: Ugh, these guys can be a real headache.
200540.name: Aedirnian Mauler

201523.flavor: He lay down next to Adda's mummified remains, drawing the Yrden Sign on the inner side of her sarcophagus' lid.
201523.info: Deploy: Restore all units on a row to their base power.
201523.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Restore all units on a row to their base power.
201523.name: Geralt: Yrden

201559.flavor: Hoooahhh! Hoooaahhh! Hooo! Prepare yer hineys, clowns! Soon we'll be comin' 'round! Tae kick 'em till ye've feet for frowns!
201559.info: Deploy, Melee:  If there is a Dwarf on this row, Summon a copy of this unit from your deck to this row.
201559.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>:  If there is a Dwarf on this row, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a copy of this unit from your deck to this row.
201559.name: Mahakam Volunteers

201574.flavor: Tall one's Wilmar. Wilfred's to his right. And the lad with the stutter's Wilhelm.
201574.info: Deathwish: Damage a random enemy unit by 2.
201574.infoRaw: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: Damage a random enemy unit by 2.
201574.name: Harald's Pal

201576.flavor: In Beauclair, everything is better: the wine is sweeter, the cows are bigger and all the ladies are above average.
201576.name: Cow

201578.flavor: You daft? You mean to sail to Skellige? Those barbarians'll tear you to shreds!
201578.info: Deploy, Melee: Split 4 damage randomly between all units.
201578.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Split 4 damage randomly between all units.
201578.name: An Craite Marauder

201579.flavor: What came first, the chicken or the egg? Compared to the conundrum that is the phoenix, that question seems downright trivial.
201579.info: On round start, if Phoenix is in your graveyard, Banish it, then Spawn Phoenix Hatchling and Summon it to a random allied row.
201579.infoRaw: On round start, if Phoenix is in your graveyard, <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> it, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Phoenix Hatchling and <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it to a random allied row.
201579.name: Phoenix

201580.flavor: Why should something as trivial as birth decide who rules over us?
201580.info: On game start, disable the enemy Leader for the duration of the battle.
201580.infoRaw: On game start, disable the enemy Leader for the duration of the battle.
201580.name: Usurper

201581.flavor: Ofieri runemasters can combine these into runewords of incredible power.
201581.info: Create and play a bronze Skellige card.
201581.infoRaw: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze Skellige card.
201581.name: Stribog Runestone

201582.flavor: I'm getting a palpable chill from this runestone… did I do something to hurt its feelings?
201582.info: Create and play a bronze Northern Realms card.
201582.infoRaw: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze Northern Realms card.
201582.name: Zoria Runestone

201583.info: Create and play a bronze Nilfgaard card.
201583.infoRaw: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze Nilfgaard card.
201583.name: Dazhbog Runestone

201584.flavor: My blades're so sharp, they can cut paper!
201584.info: Create and play a bronze Monster faction card.
201584.infoRaw: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze Monster faction card.
201584.name: Devana Runestone

201585.flavor: I grow faint at the very sight of it…
201585.info: Create and play a bronze Scoia'tael card.
201585.infoRaw: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze Scoia'tael card.
201585.name: Morana Runestone

201587.flavor: It will rise again. Elsewhere, beyond our reach. Blood will flow once more.
201587.info: Destroy an allied unit, then Spawn and play a base copy of it.
201587.infoRaw: Destroy an allied unit, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a base copy of it.
201587.name: Whispering Hillock

201589.flavor: Though we are now few and scattered, our hearts burn brighter than ever.
201589.info: Order: Boost all units in your hand by 1.
201589.infoRaw: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost all units in your hand by 1.
201589.name: Filavandrel aén Fidháil

201595.flavor: Her curse was lifted… but her appetite for raw meat remained.
201595.name: Princess Adda

201597.flavor: Eist came to Cintra to help Crach an Craite win the hand of Princess Pavetta, yet wound up winning her mother's heart for himself.
201597.info: Order: Play a Warrior from your graveyard.
201597.infoRaw: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Play a Warrior from your graveyard.
201597.name: Eist Tuirseach

201598.flavor: The simplest of objects sometimes possess the greatest power.
201598.name: Bone Talisman

201599.flavor: He hates it when you scratch his belly.
201599.info:
Thrive.
Deploy: Damage all enemy units on the opposite row by 1.
Deathwish: Repeat the Deploy ability.
201599.infoRaw:
<keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage all enemy units on the opposite row by 1.
<keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: Repeat the <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> ability.
201599.name: Werecat

201600.flavor: Some say lycanthropy's contagious - get bit by a werewolf, you turn into one yourself. Witchers know that's nonsense, of course - only a powerful curse can bring on this condition.
201600.name: Werewolf

201601.flavor: It's best not to get in Yennefer's way. Especially when she's in a hurry.
201601.info: Choose any unit or artifact on the battlefield and place it at the top of its owner's deck.
201601.infoRaw: Choose any unit or artifact on the battlefield and place it at the top of its owner's deck.
201601.name: Yennefer's Invocation

201603.flavor: Why does this monk wear studded gloves…?
201603.info: Deploy: Transform into a copy of another unit on the battlefield without changing power.
201603.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Transform into a copy of another unit on the battlefield without changing power.
201603.name: Letho: Kingslayer

201606.flavor: As for forktails, bait them thusly: pound a stake in the soil, bind a goat to it, then hide ye in nearto shrubbery posthaste.
201606.info: Deploy: Damage all other units by 1.
201606.name: Forktail

201609.flavor: The trick is to break their wills - but not their bodies.
201609.info: Deploy: If there are 4 or more units on the opposite row, Seize the lowest enemy from that row.
201609.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If there are 4 or more units on the opposite row, <keyword=seize>Seize</keyword> the lowest enemy from that row.
201609.name: Slave Hunter

201610.flavor: A free man's got a choice. A slave's choices are made for him.
201610.info: Deploy: Transform an allied unit into Slave Infantry.
201610.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Transform an allied unit into Slave Infantry.
201610.name: Slave Infantry

201611.flavor: Iorveth may have only one eye, but his inner vision is unmatched.
201611.info: If you have 4 or more Traps in your starting deck, play 2 of them at random.
201611.infoRaw: If you have 4 or more Traps in your starting deck, play 2 of them at random.
201611.name: Iorveth's Gambit

201612.flavor: What drives a slave driver? A solitary purpose: to see his orders carried out to the letter.
201612.info: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 2. Increase damage by 1 for each Locked unit.
201612.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy by 2. Increase damage by 1 for each <keyword=lock>Locked</keyword> unit.
201612.name: Slave Driver

201613.flavor: I inherited my father's ability to assume other forms - well, one other form, in my case.
201613.info:
Order: Damage an enemy by 1. 
Charge: 5.
201613.name: Saesenthessis: Blaze

201615.flavor: Before us lies Elskerdeg Pass, and beyond that, Zerrikania and Hakland. Before us lies a long and dangerous road. If we are to walk it together… let us put aside our mistrust.
201615.info: Look at a random Dwarf, Dryad, and Elf from your deck, then play one.
201615.infoRaw: Look at a random Dwarf, Dryad, and Elf from your deck, then play one.
201615.name: Isengrim's Council

201616.flavor: O Great Sun which dost in Heavens fly, save us from the lice which do so stubbornly infest our bloomers.
201616.info: Order: Swap this unit's power with an enemy's power.
201616.infoRaw: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Swap this unit's power with an enemy's power.
201616.name: Master of Disguise

201617.flavor: His is not to reason why, his is but… to peel one damned spud after another.
201617.info: Deploy: Reveal a random unit in both decks. If yours has higher power, boost self by 2.
201617.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=reveal>Reveal</keyword> a random unit in both decks. If yours has higher power, boost self by 2.
201617.name: Recruit

201618.flavor: Though famed for his many virtues, his indomitable courage first and foremost, Seltkirk was not spared the fate which met all those killed in the Battle of Upper Aedirn.
201618.info: Order, Melee: Duel an enemy unit.
201618.name: Seltkirk of Gulet

201619.flavor: Will it help? Who knows. Shouldn't do any harm, though. Probably.
201619.info: Boost a bronze Soldier by 2 and repeat its Deploy ability.
201619.infoRaw: Boost a bronze Soldier by 2 and repeat its <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> ability.
201619.name: Ointment

201620.flavor: The general thought the war for the Lormark would end quickly, with minimal losses… yet wound up fighting it for all eternity.
201620.info:
Order, Melee: Damage a unit by 1.
Cooldown: 1.
If you control Vandergrift's Blade, damage a unit by 2 instead.
201620.infoRaw:
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Damage a unit by 1.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1.
If you control Vandergrift's Blade, damage a unit by 2 instead.
201620.name: Vandergrift

201621.flavor: We live on a placid island of ignorance in the midst of black seas of infinity, and it was not meant that we should voyage far.
201621.info:
Order: Damage a unit by Kiyan's Charge count.
Charge: 1.
201621.infoRaw:
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by Kiyan's <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword> count.
<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1.
201621.name: Kiyan

201622.flavor: Not every man in the Kaedweni Army supports his king's politics. Yet not a single one would dare say that out loud.
201622.info: Deploy: If played from the deck, boost self by 4.
201622.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If played from the deck, boost self by 4.
201622.name: Kaedweni Knight

201623.flavor: Most men, seeing a massive boar in the woods, mess their trousers and scurry up the nearest tree. A Skelliger, though - he just drools.
201623.info: Deploy, Melee: Boost self by 1 for every damaged unit.
201623.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Boost self by 1 for every damaged unit.
201623.name: Giant Boar

201624.flavor: Doomed to repeat the same day over and over again, just like the employees of Cianfanelli Bank.
201624.info: Order: Damage a unit by 1. If it was destroyed, Spawn a base copy of Kaedweni Revenant and Summon it to this row.
201624.infoRaw: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by 1. If it was destroyed, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of Kaedweni Revenant and <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it to this row.
201624.name: Kaedweni Revenant

201625.flavor: He fights an endless war whose beginning he no longer remembers.
201625.info: Deploy: Transform an allied unit that is not a Cursed Knight into a Cursed Knight without changing its power.
201625.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Transform an allied unit that is not a Cursed Knight into a Cursed Knight without changing its power.
201625.name: Cursed Knight

201626.flavor: Zireael possesses a great power she cannot control. She is a danger - to herself, to others. Until she learns to control it, she should remain isolated.
201626.info: On turn start, if this is the only unit in your graveyard, Summon it to a random allied row.
201626.infoRaw: On turn start, if this is the only unit in your graveyard, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it to a random allied row.
201626.name: Ciri: Nova

201627.flavor: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?
201627.info:
Doomed.
If your starting deck has no duplicates, send Shupe on an adventure.
201627.infoRaw:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
If your starting deck has no duplicates, send Shupe on an adventure.
201627.name: Shupe's Day Off

201628.flavor: Prohibited? Yes. Eliminated? Far from it.
201628.info: Damage an enemy by 1 for every Specter ally.
201628.infoRaw: Damage an enemy by 1 for every Specter ally.
201628.name: Forbidden Magic

201630.flavor: Sabrina's curse spared no one, not even her fellow practitioners.
201630.name: Damned Sorceress

201631.flavor: Humans despise dopplers so much, they feel mere execution does not suffice - so they tie any they catch to a stake, cover them in thick clay and bake them in a fire.
201631.info: Deploy: Choose a unit in your hand, then boost self by the total number of units in your hand which have the same primary category as that unit.
201631.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Choose a unit in your hand, then boost self by the total number of units in your hand which have the same primary category as that unit.

201632.flavor: What's written on this blade? That a curse? No. An insult.
201632.info:
Zeal.
Order: Damage an enemy by 1.
Cooldown: 1.
Whenever Sihil destroys an enemy, increase Sihil's Order damage by 1 until moved from the battlefield.

Whenever Sihil destroys an enemy, increase Sihil's <keyword=order>Order</keyword> damage by 1 until moved from the battlefield.
201632.name: Sihil

201633.flavor: There are weapons banned in all the Northern Realms, for the wounds they deal are horrible beyond all imagining.
201633.info:
Zeal.
Order: Damage an enemy by Bloody Flail's Charge count, then remove all Charges.
Charge: 1.
Whenever an allied unit gains Charges, gain the same amount.

<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.

Whenever an allied unit gains <keyword=charge>Charges</keyword>, gain the same amount.

201634.flavor: All it takes is one pebble and we're all done for.
201634.name: Bekker's Rockslide

201635.flavor: By the gods' gonads, witcher, why'd you bring me this filth?! I want that beast's head! - that was a ploughin' figure of ploughin' speech!
201635.info: Destroy the unit with the highest base power.
201635.infoRaw: Destroy the unit with the highest base power.
201635.name: Glorious Hunt

201636.flavor: Hated by men, reviled by elves and always picked last during schoolyard games. No wonder half-elves tend to have a chip on their shoulder.
201636.info: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 1 for each artifact you control.
201636.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy by 1 for each artifact you control.
201636.name: Half-Elf Hunter

201637.flavor: In Zerrikania, dragon worship dominates every aspect of daily life. Thus it comes as no surprise they name weapons in their honor.
201637.info:
Apply this row effect to an enemy row:
After 3 turns, on turn start, explode and damage all units on this row by 3.
201637.infoRaw:
Apply this row effect to an enemy row:
After 3 turns, on turn start, explode and damage all units on this row by 3.
201637.name: Dragon's Dream

201638.flavor: They say elves leave no tracks in the snow, but if you ask me, they are just a pack of village idiots, babbling nonsense.
201638.info: Whenever an allied Trap is triggered, boost self by 2.
201638.infoRaw: Whenever an allied Trap is triggered, boost self by 2.
201638.name: Elven Scout

201644.flavor: No one'd ever think I could be a skilled armorer - a human, and a woman to boot. A dwarven blacksmith - that's another story…
201644.info:
Order: Heal an ally by 1.
Charge: 1.
Gain 1 Charge whenever an adjacent unit takes damage.
201644.infoRaw:
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> an ally by 1.
<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1.
Gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword> whenever an adjacent unit takes damage.
201644.name: Yoana

201645.flavor: When this knocks you down, you don't get up again.
201645.info:
Ambush: After 3 turns, on turn end, damage all enemy units on the row with the most units by 2. 
Zeal.
Order: Flip over and damage all units on a row by 1.
201645.infoRaw:
<keyword=ambush>Ambush</keyword>: After 3 turns, on turn end, damage all enemy units on the row with the most units by 2. 
<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Flip over and damage all units on a row by 1.
201645.name: Crushing Trap

201646.flavor: Whatever caused this madness must have been terrifying…
201646.info: Deploy, Ranged: Move up to 3 cards from your deck to your graveyard.
201646.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: Move up to 3 cards from your deck to your graveyard.
201646.name: Derran

201647.flavor: Someday, when you are older, you could get hit by a boulder.
201647.info: Damage an enemy by 4 and move it to the other row.
201647.infoRaw: Damage an enemy by 4 and move it to the other row.
201647.name: Rock Barrage

201648.flavor: Seltkirk shattered Vandergrift's sword during a knights' tourney in Ard Carraigh. Afterwards Vandergrift, enraged at his weapon's failure, ordered a new one forged, this time with powerful runestones enchanted into it.
201648.info: Whenever you play a Soldier on this row, boost it by 2.
201648.infoRaw: Whenever you play a Soldier on this row, boost it by 2.
201648.name: Vandergrift's Blade

201650.flavor: With her dying breath, Sabrina Glevissig cast a powerful curse that struck not only her executioners, but all who stood nearby.
201650.info: Damage each non-Specter unit by 1. If any were destroyed, repeat this ability once.
201650.infoRaw: Damage each non-Specter unit by 1. If any were destroyed, repeat this ability once.
201650.name: Sabrina's Inferno

201653.flavor: Once upon a time, Mahakam held a horn-blowing contest. That day the dwarves made an important discovery: loud noises and snow-capped peaks do not play well together.
201653.info: Ambush: When your opponent passes, boost adjacent units by 4.
201653.infoRaw: <keyword=ambush>Ambush</keyword>: When your opponent passes, boost adjacent units by 4.
201653.name: Mahakam Horn

201656.flavor: Hold that spear up, weakling! Not a single horse shall pass!
201656.info:
Zeal.
Order: Damage a unit by 1.  
Cooldown: 1.
201656.name: Mastercrafted Spear

201657.info: Damage an enemy by 6, or boost an ally by 6.
201657.infoRaw: Damage an enemy by 6, or boost an ally by 6.

201659.infoRaw: Play a bronze Machine from your graveyard.

201662.flavor: I don't trust my life to chance. I trust it to a thick coating of Cadaverine on my blade.
201662.info:
Zeal.
Order: Destroy self and all units whose power equals Cadaverine's Charge count.
Charge: 0.
Every turn, on turn start, and whenever you play a Tactic, gain 1 Charge.

201676.flavor: No one smuggled as much food to the elves of the Blue Mountains as Gale. He'd bring them sacks of turnips and, prized most of all, leeks.
201676.info:
Order: Damage a unit by 1. 
Cooldown: 1.
201676.name: Pavko Gale

201696.flavor: Move yer arses! It's a ploughin' trap!

201696.infoRaw: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost the unit on the left by 4, or give the unit on the right <keyword=immune>Immune</keyword>.

201697.infoRaw: The next time an enemy receives a boost, destroy that unit and self.

201698.flavor: Some necrophages have taken such a liking to human flesh, they no longer are content to merely dig up corpses...

201700.flavor: This here bridge? Trolls built it a long time ago. Sat under it, made folk pay 'em a hefty copper to pass. Thing is, not many folk pass this way. So they all packed up, went their way. Not the bridge, though. It stayed.
201700.info: Deathwish: Boost the highest ally by 4.

201701.flavor: What moments before looked like round rocks among the stalagmites now stared at him with enormous, bright, menacing eyes.

Charge: 2.

201704.flavor: If our scouts don't come back, we turn around. The yokels claim these woods are full o' squirrels - and I don't mean the nut-gatherin' kind.

201744.flavor: Carried by the wind across the Continent... Sowing madness and blight where they fall.

201748.flavor: As King Foltest likes to say, it's not size that counts, but whether it gets the job done.

Order, Melee: Damage an enemy and all other enemies with power equal to it by 1. 
Charge: 1.

201749.flavor: Smell that? That's the smell of happiness.
201749.info: Boost all units on a row by 2.
201749.infoRaw: Boost all units on a row by 2.
201749.name: Golden Froth

201753.flavor: We's the militia. We keep the peace.
201753.name: Peasant Militia

201772.flavor: I accepted a job once, did it. Asked to choose my reward, I invoked the Law of Surprise.
201772.info: Deploy, Melee: Damage an enemy by 3. If its power was a multiple of 3, destroy it instead.
201772.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Damage an enemy by 3. If its power was a multiple of 3, destroy it instead.
201772.name: Geralt: Professional

201773.flavor: Bindings won't suffice. Nor will a gag render her any less dangerous. No, dimeritium is the only solution.
201773.info: Deploy, Ranged: Create and play a bronze special card from either player's current deck.
201773.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze special card from either player's current deck.
201773.name: Triss: Telekinesis

201774.flavor: Dandelion told me all about your adventures. How he'd ready you for battle with his songs, how he tamed the kayran by playin' his lute...
201774.name: Dandelion: Vainglory

201776.flavor: The quill is mightier than the sword.
201776.info: Deploy: Draw a card, then play a card.
201776.infoRaw: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Draw a card, then play a card.

201777.flavor: Fear does not befit us. Yet, there is a certain d'hoine... Vernon Roche. Be wary of him.

Order: Seize an enemy whose power is less than or equal to Roche Merciless' Charge count, then remove all Charges. 
Charge: 0.
Every turn, on turn start, gain 1 Charge.

Every turn, on turn start, gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>.

201779.flavor: I hold Brokilon dearer than my own life. She is a mother who cares for her children. I will defend her to my final breath.

201779.infoRaw: Shuffle an allied unit into your deck, then play a different unit with the same primary category from your deck and boost it by 3.

201780.flavor: Yes, I have seen the future. And you're not in it.

201781.infoRaw:
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: If you control the highest unit, damage a unit by 2.

201817.flavor: Inconceivable. Impossible, Ciri thought, returning to her senses. Unicorns don't exist, not any more, not in this world. Unicorns are extinct.
